definition: to get a promotion
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank
to climb step by step/to rise steadily/on the up and up

sentences.english: Then the king promoted Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, in the province of Babylon.
sentences.chinese: 那时王在巴比伦省，高升了沙得拉，米煞，亚伯尼歌。

sentences.english: I hope there will be a promotion for you this year.
A dozen of them kept training until the sun had fully risen. Then they would have the breakfast together.
sentences.chinese: 十几个人练到旭日高升时，才一起去吃早餐。

sentences.english: Mr. Wang has risen in his profession over the past five years.
sentences.chinese: 过去五年中，王先生在他专业里，步步高升。

sentences.english: Neurogenesis ramped way up, then, after several weeks, sputtered and slowed.
sentences.chinese: 神经发生次数一路高升，然后几周后突然减缓。

sentences.english: Let rise in lanterns and Dai also unique to the region.
sentences.chinese: 放高升和孔明灯也是傣族地区特有的活动。

sentences.english: The temperature gets high up to 110F.
In the light of his aptitude, personality and diligence, he will surly be promoted soon.
sentences.chinese: 他能力强，人品好，办事勤快，显然会步步高升的。

sentences.english: This article introduces the gathering and transferring process flow of mixing heavy crude with light crude in Liaohe Gaoshen oilfield.
sentences.chinese: 本文介绍了辽河高升油田稠油掺稀油降粘的集输流程。

sentences.english: Or when the moon was overhead.
He hopes to move onward and upward with his current company.
sentences.chinese: 他希望能在现在就职之公司里顺利发展，步步高升。

sentences.english: By aptitude, personality and work he is obviously slated to go up.
sentences.chinese: 他有才能，人品好，办事勤奋，显然会步步高升。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the American English often use direct rising tone or high rising tone which is straight and simple.
sentences.chinese: 而美式英语常用直升调或高升调，平白直述。

sentences.english: Afterward, he returned to the Imperial Starfleet and rose through the ranks.
sentences.chinese: 在此之后，他回到帝国星舰舰队并节节高升。

definition: to climb step by step/to rise steadily/on the up and up
to get promoted
rising straight up in a clear sky (idiom); rapid promotion to a high post/meteoric career
(of a political career) everything is going smoothly (idiom)
promote/promotion
to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
flushed with success/proud of one's success (in exams, promotion etc)/as pleased as punch
to lead by the hand/to guide/to support
promotion to the nobility (idiom)
to be promoted to
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to have a future full of promise
to promote to a higher position
